jbeast_dot_org wrote:
> Heloo JUnit group,
> 
> I am required to mark a simple board game engine for a java
> programming course,  *30 students
> 
> I can make a simple test case to play a game using random inputs until
> someone wins whilst making assertions against a known perfect
> implementation.
> 
> this works and is good.
> 
> however,
> 
> firstly I want to run each test say 50 times with the same engine(50
> random games) but i don't want to stop at the first failure. I was
> just looping for 50 but it stops on fail. How do I run the same test
> 50 times (no need for different inputs) OR should I just script this.

Wrap your test in a junit.extensions.RepeatedTest 
(http://www.junit.org/junit/javadoc/3.8.1/junit/extensions/RepeatedTest.html)

> secondly I want to extract some info from the test upon failure. ie
> the sequence of moves which caused failure OR error.
> My test case keeps track of the sequence of moves during a game, i'd
> like a hook into printing this only if the engine fails an assertion
> or spouts an error; (arrayoutofbounds) more than likely.

Make an explicit fail() call in the failure condition, and have it dump 
to sequence.

> I'm a stranger to junit but no stranger to java, if some body could
> just point me in the direction of which methods of which classes to
> implement or override i'd be most grateful.
> 
> As sample output i would some thing very vaguely like
> 
> test 4/50 failed: failed sequence follows.
> A1 B2 A3 B6 A3 B4 A3 B5 A3 .....
> 
> test 44/50 failed: failed sequence follows.
> A1 B2 A1 B6 A3 B5 A3 B3 A3 .....
> 
> many thanks
subject: Re: [junit] output from test on failure
